intro: Ardisia patens var. tonkinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese evergreen, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam, and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
